column4: target_content
column5: justification

column4: Climate Neutrality (2040 target under discussion)
column5: This target is directly related to reducing greenhouse gas emissions, which is a core aspect of achieving climate neutrality.

column4: The total quantity of allowances for the new emissions trading system should follow a linear trajectory to reach the emission reduction target for 2030, taking into account the cost-efficient contribution of the buildings and road transport sectors of 43 % emission reductions by 2030 compared to 2005 and of the additional sectors, a combined cost-efficient contribution of 42 % emission reductions by 2030 compared to 2005.
column5: This target focuses on emission reductions through a trading system, directly impacting GHG emissions.

column4: Upgrade national targets in line with an EU-wide reduction of 40% in the ESR sectors compared to 2005. Member States contribute to the overall EU reduction in 2030 with targets ranging from -10% to -50% below 2005 level (sectors: transport, buildings, agriculture and waste)
column5: This target involves setting national targets for emission reductions, which is a key component of managing GHG emissions.

column4: Achieve an EU net greenhouse gas removal of 310 million tonnes CO2 equivalent per year for the land use, land use change and forestry (LULUCF) sector
column5: This target is about removing greenhouse gases, which is a direct action towards reducing overall GHG emissions.

column4: For the period from 2021 to 2025 each Member State shall ensure that greenhouse gas emissions from the sector do not exceed greenhouse gas removals, calculated as the sum of total emissions and total removals on its territory in all of the land accounting categories (no debit rule). The accounting benchmark for the EU is ca. -229 Mt CO2e/yr for 2021-2025.
column5: This target focuses on balancing emissions and removals, which is essential for managing GHG emissions.

column4: Each Member State shall ensure that the annual sum of its greenhouse gas emissions and removals on its territory and in all of the land reporting categories, in each year in the period from 2026 to 2030, does not exceed the limit established by a linear trajectory, ending in 2030 on the target set out for that Member State(no debit rule)
column5: This target involves setting limits on emissions and removals, which is crucial for controlling GHG emissions.

column4: Reduce buildings’ greenhouse gas emissions by 60%, compared to 2015 levels, by 2030
column5: This target specifically addresses the reduction of GHG emissions from buildings, a significant source of emissions.

column4: To achieve 55% reduction of GHG emission by 2030, methane emissions related to energy production and consumption should be reduced by 58% compared to the level in 2020
column5: This target focuses on reducing methane emissions, a potent greenhouse gas, as part of the broader GHG emissions reduction strategy.

column4: 2040 target under discussion
column5: This target is related to future GHG emissions reduction goals, which are central to climate ambition.

column4: Reduce of 55% GHG emissions compared to 1990 levels (2040 target under discussion)
column5: This target sets a specific reduction goal for GHG emissions, aligning with the overall climate ambition.

column4: Achieve a climate-resilient society status, fully adapted to the unavoidable impacts of climate change
column5: This target focuses on building resilience to climate change impacts, which is a key aspect of climate adaptation.

column4: CBAM
column5: This target relates to the Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism, which is designed to prevent carbon leakage and support climate ambition.

column4: Recast
column5: This target involves regulatory changes, which are necessary for implementing climate policies.

column4: Reduce methane emissions of 35% if compared to 2005 levels
column5: This target specifically addresses methane emissions, a significant contributor to climate change.

column4: Reach energy neutrality in the wastewater treatment sector by 2040. To reach energy neutrality and the additional treatment of nitrogen, GHG emissions would be reduced by 4,86 million tonnes (37,32 % of the avoidable emissions from the sector)
column5: This target focuses on achieving energy neutrality in a specific sector, contributing to overall emissions reduction.

column4: The contribution of the sectors covered by the EU ETS with respect to the EU Climate ambition should be of -62 % compared to 2005 (increasing the linear emissions reduction factor from 2.2 % per year up to 4.4 %)
column5: This target is related to the EU Emissions Trading System, a key tool for reducing GHG emissions.

column4: Renewable hydrogen will be key to replace natural gas, coal and oil in hard-to-decarbonise industries and transport. REPowerEU sets a target of 10 million tonnes of domestic renewable hydrogen production and 10 million tonnes of renewable hydrogen imports by 2030
column5: This target focuses on the production and import of renewable hydrogen, a crucial element for decarbonizing energy-intensive sectors.

column4: Member States shall set an indicative target for innovative renewable energy technology of at least 5 % of newly installed renewable energy capacity by 2030
column5: This target encourages the adoption of innovative renewable energy technologies, which are essential for advancing clean energy solutions.

column4: By 31 December 2025, each Member State shall agree to establish a framework for cooperation on joint projects with one or more other Member States for the production of renewable energy, subject to the following: by 31 December 2030, Member States shall endeavour to agree on establishing at least two joint projects, by 31 December 2033, Member States with an annual electricity consumption of more than 100 TWh shall endeavour to agree on establishing a third joint project
column5: This target promotes collaboration between Member States on renewable energy projects, enhancing energy security and sustainability.

column4: Member States shall endeavour to increase the share of renewable sources in the amount of energy sources used for final energy and non-energy purposes in the industry sector by an indicative increase of at least 1,6 percentage points as an annual average calculated for the periods 2021 to 2025 and 2026 to 2030.
column5: This target focuses on increasing the use of renewable energy in the industry sector, contributing to overall energy sustainability.

column4: Each Member State shall set an obligation on fuel suppliers to ensure that: (a) the amount of renewable fuels and renewable electricity supplied to the transport sector leads to a: (i) share of renewable energy within the final consumption of energy in the transport sector of at least 29 % by 2030, or i) greenhouse gas intensity reduction of at least 14,5 % by 2030, compared to the baseline set out in Article 27(1), point (b), in accordance with an indicative trajectory set by the Member State,
column5: This target aims to increase the share of renewable energy in the transport sector, reducing its carbon footprint.

column4: Member States shall endeavour to increase the share of energy from renewable sources and from waste heat and cold in district heating and cooling by an indicative 2,2 percentage points as an annual average calculated for the period 2021 to 2030, starting from the share of energy from renewable sources and from waste heat and cold in district heating and cooling in 2020
column5: This target focuses on increasing the use of renewable energy in district heating and cooling systems, contributing to energy efficiency.

column4: By 2022 achieve 18% of the total increase in the share of energy from renewable sources between that Member State's binding 2020 national target, and its contribution to the 2030 target of share of energy from renewable sources in gross final consumption of energy. Achieve 43% by 2025, 65% by 2027
column5: This target sets specific milestones for increasing the share of renewable energy, aligning with broader energy transition goals.

column4: Each Member State shall increase the share of renewable energy in that sector by at least 0,8 percentage points as an annual average calculated for the period 2021 to 2025 and by at least 1,1 percentage points as an annual average calculated for the period 2026 to 2030, starting from the share of renewable energy in the heating and cooling sector in 2020
column5: This target aims to increase the share of renewable energy in the heating and cooling sector, enhancing energy sustainability.

column4: the Union’s 2030 targets for energy and climate” means the Union-wide binding target for reducing greenhouse gas emissions in 2030 referred to in Article 4(1) of Regulation (EU) 2021/1119, the Union’s binding target for renewable energy for 2030 set in Article 3(1) of Directive (EU) 2018/2001, the Union-level target for improving energy efficiency in 2030 referred to in Article 4(1) of Directive (EU) .../... of the European Parliament and of the Council*+ and the 15 % electricity interconnection target for 2030 or any subsequent targets in that regard agreed by the European Council or by the European Parliament and by the Council for 2030.
column5: This target encompasses multiple energy and climate goals, highlighting the interconnectedness of these objectives.

column4: Member States shall determine an indicative national share of renewable energy produced on-site or nearby as well as renewable energy taken from the grid in final energy consumption in their building sector in 2030 that is consistent with an indicative target of at least a 49 % share of energy from renewable sources in the building sector in the Union’s final energy consumption in buildings in 2030
column5: This target focuses on increasing the share of renewable energy in the building sector, contributing to energy efficiency and sustainability.

column4: The fisheries sector must follow the two mutually reinforcing paths of reducing energy intensity, on the one hand, and switching to renewable and low-carbon energy sources, on the other hand
column5: This target addresses the energy transition in the fisheries sector, promoting the use of renewable and low-carbon energy sources.

column4: Set up at least one renewables-based energy community in every municipality with a population higher than 10.000
column5: This target encourages the establishment of renewable energy communities, fostering local energy production and consumption.

column4: Renovate each year at least 3% of the total floor area of buildings owned by all levels of public administration (as also agreed by Council-Parliament on 10.03.23)
column5: This target focuses on renovating public buildings to improve energy efficiency and reduce emissions.

column4: Member States shall ensure that the total final energy consumption of all public bodies combined is reduced by at least 1,9 % each year, when compared to 2021 (art. 5.1 Directive)
column5: This target aims to reduce energy consumption in public bodies, contributing to overall energy efficiency.

column4: Member States shall collectively ensure a reduction of energy consumption of at least 11,7 % in 2030 compared to the projections of the 2020 EU Reference Scenario so that the Union’s final energy consumption amounts to no more than 763 Mtoe (art. 4 Directive)
column5: This target sets a collective goal for reducing energy consumption, aligning with broader energy efficiency objectives.

column4: Member States shall make efforts to collectively contribute to the indicative Union primary energy consumption target amounting to no more than 992,5 Mtoe in 2030 (art. 4 Directive) -> 39% savings for primary energy consumption in the EU
column5: This target focuses on reducing primary energy consumption, contributing to energy efficiency and sustainability.

column4: Each Member State shall ensure that at least 3 % of the total floor area of heated and/or cooled buildings (of buildings which have a total useful floor area of over 250 m2) that are owned by public bodies is renovated each year to be transformed into at least nearly zero-energy buildings or zero-emission buildings in accordance with Article 9 of Directive 2010/31/EU
column5: This target promotes the renovation of public buildings to achieve nearly zero-energy or zero-emission status, enhancing energy efficiency.

column4: Reduce buildings' final energy consumption by 14%
column5: This target aims to reduce the final energy consumption of buildings, contributing to energy efficiency.

column4: At least double the annual energy renovation rate of residential and non-residential buildings by 2030 and to foster deep energy renovations
column5: This target focuses on increasing the rate of energy renovations in buildings, enhancing energy efficiency.

column4: Indicative national targets aiming to achieve the deep renovation of at least 35 million building units by 2030 to support reaching an annual energy renovation rate of 3 % or more for the period till 2050 (see latest test adopted by EP on 14.03.2023)
column5: This target sets specific goals for building renovations, contributing to energy efficiency and sustainability.

column4: Reduce buildings' energy consumption for heating and cooling by 18%
column5: This target focuses on reducing energy consumption for heating and cooling in buildings, enhancing energy efficiency.

column4: For the non-residential building stock, the revised rules require to gradually improve it via minimum energy performance standards. This will lead to renovating the 16% worst-performing buildings by 2030 and the 26% worst-performing buildings by 2033.
column5: This target sets standards for improving the energy performance of non-residential buildings, contributing to energy efficiency.

column4: Member States shall ensure that the contribution of renewable fuels of non-biological origin used for final energy and non-energy purposes shall be at least 42 % of the hydrogen used for final energy and non-energy purposes in industry by 2030, and 60 % by 2035
column5: This target focuses on increasing the use of renewable hydrogen in industry, contributing to energy sustainability.

column4: The revised directive will make zero-emission buildings the new standard for new buildings. Under the agreement all new residential and non-residential buildings must have zero on-site emissions from fossil fuels, as of 1 January 2028 for publicly-owned buildings and as of 1 January 2030 for all other new buildings, with a possibility for specific exemptions.
column5: This target sets a standard for zero-emission buildings, contributing to energy efficiency and sustainability.

column4: All existing buildings should be transformed into zero-emission buildings
column5: This target focuses on transforming existing buildings into zero-emission buildings, enhancing energy efficiency.

column4: 100% of on-site energy consumption to be covered by renewable energy as for new buildings
column5: This target aims to cover all on-site energy consumption with renewable energy in new buildings, contributing to energy sustainability.

column4: The national measures will have to ensure that at least 55% of the decrease of the average primary energy use is achieved through the renovation of the worst-performing buildings
column5: This target focuses on reducing primary energy use through building renovations, enhancing energy efficiency.

column4: Each Member State will adopt its own national trajectory to reduce the average primary energy use of residential buildings by 16% by 2030 and 20-22% by 2035
column5: This target sets goals for reducing primary energy use in residential buildings, contributing to energy efficiency.

column4: Member States will also have to set out specific measures on the phase-out of fossil fuels in heating and cooling with a view to a complete phase-out of boilers powered by fossil fuels by 2040
column5: This target focuses on phasing out fossil fuels in heating and cooling, contributing to energy sustainability.

column4: See ‘Commission welcomes political agreement on new rules to boost energy performance of buildings across the EU’
column5: This target relates to improving the energy performance of buildings, enhancing energy efficiency.

column4: By 2030, the share of renewable energy in the electricity mix should double to 55-60%, and projections show a share of around 84% by 2050. The remaining gap should be covered by other low-carbon options
column5: This target sets goals for increasing the share of renewable energy in the electricity mix, contributing to energy sustainability.

column4: The strategy sets targets for an installed capacity of at least 60 GW of offshore wind by 2030 and at least 300 GW by 2050. Grounding on the revised TEN-E regulation, EU countries have agreed on new, ambitious long-term goals for the deployment of offshore renewable energy up to 2050 in each of the EU’s five sea basins. As a result, the cumulative EU offshore goals have the following ranges: 109-112 GW by 2030, 215-248 GW by 2040, and 281-354 GW by 2050.
column5: This target focuses on increasing offshore wind energy capacity, contributing to renewable energy goals.

column4: The strategy sets targets for an installed capacity of at least 1 GW of ocean energy by 2030 and 40 GW by 2050
column5: This target sets goals for ocean energy capacity, contributing to renewable energy development.

column4: Doubling the current deployment rate of individual heat pumps, resulting in a cumulative 10 million units by 2027 and 30 million units by 2030
column5: This target focuses on increasing the deployment of heat pumps, contributing to energy efficiency and sustainability.

column4: Around 30% of EU primary steel production is expected to be decarbonized on the basis of renewable hydrogen
column5: This target focuses on decarbonizing steel production using renewable hydrogen, contributing to industrial sustainability.

column4: Bring online over 320 GW of solar photovoltaic by 2025 and 600 GW by 2030
column5: This target sets goals for solar photovoltaic capacity, contributing to renewable energy development.

column4: Energy demand to be covered by solar heat and geothermal should at least triple (currently rate at 1,5%)
column5: This target focuses on increasing the use of solar heat and geothermal energy, contributing to renewable energy goals.

column4: Over this decade, the EU will need to install, on average, approximately 45 GW per year of PV to reach the share of 45% of energy coming from renewables set out in the RePowerEU Plan
column5: This target sets installation goals for solar photovoltaic, contributing to renewable energy development.

column4: Ensure that energy poor and vulnerable consumers have access to solar energy, e.g. through social housing installations, energy communities, or financing support for individual installations
column5: This target focuses on providing access to solar energy for vulnerable consumers, enhancing energy equity.

column4: Member States shall collectively ensure that the share of energy from renewable sources in the Union’s gross final consumption of energy in 2030 is at least 42,5 %.
column5: This target sets a collective goal for the share of renewable energy, contributing to energy sustainability.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Halve the amount of residual (non-recycled) municipal waste
column5: This target focuses on reducing residual municipal waste, contributing to a circular economy.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Union's access to a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials by ensuring that the Union's recycling capacity, including for all intermediate recycling steps, is able to produce at least 15% of the Union's annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column5: This target focuses on securing a sustainable supply of critical raw materials through recycling, contributing to resource efficiency.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Diversify the Union's imports of strategic raw materials with a view to ensure that the Union's annual consumption of each strategic raw material at any relevant stage of processing can rely on imports from several third countries, none of which provide more than 65% of the Union's annual consumption
column5: This target aims to diversify imports of strategic raw materials, enhancing supply chain resilience.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: by 2030, manufacturing capacity in the Union of the strategic net-zero technologies listed in the Annex approaches or reaches a benchmark of at least 40% of the Union’s annual deployment needs for the corresponding technologies necessary to achieve the Union’s 2030 climate and energy targets
column5: This target focuses on increasing manufacturing capacity for net-zero technologies, contributing to industrial sustainability.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: nan
column5: This target is related to batteries, which are crucial for energy storage and a circular economy.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: nan
column5: This target is related to batteries, which are crucial for energy storage and a circular economy.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Producers of portable batteries or, where appointed in accordance with Article 57(1), producer responsibility organisations, shall ensure that all waste portable batteries, Light Means of Transport (LMT) and SLI batteries, regardless of their nature, chemical composition, condition, brand or origin, are collected separately in the territory of a Member State where they make these batteries available on the market for the first time.
column5: This target focuses on the collection of waste batteries, contributing to a circular economy.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Producers of portable batteries or producer responsibility organisations, shall attain, and maintain durably, at least the following collection targets for waste portable batteries: 45 % by 31 December 2023, 63 % by 31 December 2027, 73 % by 31 December 2030.
column5: This target sets specific collection targets for waste batteries, contributing to a circular economy.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Producers of LMT (Light Means of Transport) batteries or producer responsibility organisations, shall attain, and maintain durably, at least the following collection targets of waste LMT batteries: 51 % by 31 December 2028, 61 % by 31 December 2031.
column5: This target sets specific collection targets for LMT batteries, contributing to a circular economy.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Recycled content in industrial batteries, electric vehicle batteries, LMT batteries and SLI batteries: Cobalt: 16 % by 2031 (26% by 2036), Lead: 85% (85%), Nickel: 6% (12%), Lithium 6% (15%)
column5: This target focuses on increasing the recycled content in batteries, contributing to resource efficiency.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: All batteries incorporated in market products shall be readily removable and replaceable by the end-user at any time during the lifetime (except some derogations)
column5: This target focuses on battery design for easy removal and replacement, contributing to a circular economy.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Reduce landfill to a maximum of 10% of municipal waste
column5: This target focuses on reducing landfill use, contributing to waste reduction and a circular economy.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recycling efficiency: No later than 31 December 2025 - 75% by average weight of lead-acid batteries, - 80% by average weight of nickel-cadmium batteries - 50% by average weight of other waste batteries No later than 31 December 2030 - 80% by average weight of lead-acid batteries,
column5: This target sets specific recycling efficiency targets for batteries, contributing to resource efficiency.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recycling efficiency: No later than 31 December 2025 - 65% by average weight of lithium-based batteries, No later than 31 December 2030 - 70% by average weight of lithium-based batterie
column5: This target sets specific recycling efficiency targets for lithium-based batteries, contributing to resource efficiency.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: All recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recovery of materials: No later than 31 December 2027 -90% for cobalt, copper, lead and nickel, No later than 31 December 2031: -95% for cobalt, copper, lead, and nickel,
column5: This target sets specific material recovery targets, contributing to resource efficiency.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: All recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recovery of materials: No later than 31 December 2027 -50% lithium No later than 31 December 2031: -80% lithium
column5: This target sets specific material recovery targets for lithium, contributing to resource efficiency.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Reduce the generation of food waste in processing and manufacturing by 10% in comparison to the amount generated in 2020
column5: This target focuses on reducing food waste in processing and manufacturing, contributing to a circular economy.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Reduce the generation of food waste per capita, jointly in retail and other distribution of food, in restaurants and food services and in households, by 30 % in comparison to the amount generated in 2020
column5: This target focuses on reducing food waste across various sectors, contributing to a circular economy.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: nan
column5: This target is related to batteries, which are crucial for energy storage and a circular economy.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Making all packaging recyclable (see European Parliament resolution of 10 February 2021 on the New Circular Economy Action Plan, the New Circular Economy Action Plan and art. 5 of this Proposal)
column5: This target focuses on making all packaging recyclable, contributing to a circular economy.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: The plastic part in packaging shall contain the following minimum percentage of recycled content recovered from post-consumer plastic waste, per unit of packaging: From 1 January 2030 (i) 30% for contact sensitive packaging made from polyethylene terephthalate (PET) as major component, (ii) 10% for contact sensitive made from plastic materials other than PET, except single use plastic bottles, (iii) 30% for single use plastic beverage bottles, (iv) 35% for other plastic packaging From 1 January 2040 (v) 50% for contact sensitive plastic packaging, except single use plastic beverage bottles, (vi) 65% for single use plastic beverage bottles, (vii) 65% for other plastic packaging
column5: This target sets specific recycled content requirements for packaging, contributing to resource efficiency.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Member States shall take measures to achieve a sustained reduction in the consumption of lightweight plastic carrier bags on their territory. A sustained reduction is achieved if the annual consumption does not exceed 40 lightweight plastic carrier bags per person, or the equivalent target in weight, by 31 December 2025, and subsequently by 31 December in each year thereafter
column5: This target focuses on reducing the consumption of plastic bags, contributing to waste reduction and a circular economy.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Double its circular material use rate in the coming decade
column5: This target focuses on increasing the circular material use rate, contributing to a circular economy.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Reduce packaging waste by 5% per Member State per capita compared to 2018 by 2030, 10% by 2035 and 15% by 2040
column5: This target sets specific goals for reducing packaging waste, contributing to waste reduction and a circular economy.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Recycling or preparing for re-use 65% of all packaging waste by 2025, 70% by 2030
column5: This target sets specific recycling targets for packaging waste, contributing to resource efficiency.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Recycling of plastic in packaging: 55%
column5: This target sets a specific recycling target for plastic packaging, contributing to resource efficiency.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Recycling of wood in packaging: 30%
column5: This target sets a specific recycling target for wood packaging, contributing to resource efficiency.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Recycling of ferrous metals in packaging: 80%
column5: This target sets a specific recycling target for ferrous metal packaging, contributing to resource efficiency.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Recycling of aluminium in packaging: 60%
column5: This target sets a specific recycling target for aluminium packaging, contributing to resource efficiency.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Recycling of glass in packaging: 75%
column5: This target sets a specific recycling target for glass packaging, contributing to resource efficiency.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Recycling of paper and cardboard in packaging: 85%
column5: This target sets a specific recycling target for paper and cardboard packaging, contributing to resource efficiency.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: nan
column5: This target is related to batteries, which are crucial for energy storage and a circular economy.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: From 2025, beverage bottles listed in Part F of the Annex which are manufactured from polyethylene terephthalate as the major component (‘PET bottles’) contain at least 25 % recycled plastic, calculated as an average for all PET bottles placed on the market on the territory of that Member State
column5: This target sets a specific recycled content requirement for PET bottles, contributing to resource efficiency.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: By 2030 textile products placed on the EU market are long-lived and recyclable, to a great extent made of recycled fibres, free of hazardous substances and produced in respect of social rights and the environment
column5: This target focuses on improving the sustainability of textile products, contributing to a circular economy.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Member States shall meet the target of 77% by weight for the separate collection for recycling of waste single-use plastic beverage bottles by 2025 and 90% by 2029
column5: This target sets specific collection targets for plastic beverage bottles, contributing to a circular economy.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: From 2019, the minimum collection rate to be achieved annually shall be 65 % of the average weight of EEE placed on the market in the three preceding years in the Member State concerned, or alternatively 85 % of WEEE generated on the territory of that Member State.
column5: This target sets specific collection targets for waste electrical and electronic equipment, contributing to a circular economy.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: From 15 August 2018, the recovery targets for the WEEE falling within the following categories of Annex III shall be: - 85% for Category 1 (temperature exchange equipment) or Category 4 (large equipment with any external dimension more than 50 cm) - 80% for Category 2 (e.g., screens and monitors) - 75% for Category 5 (small equipment with no external dimension more than 50 cm) or 6 (Small IT and telecommunication equipment with no external dimension more than 50 cm).
column5: This target sets specific recovery targets for waste electrical and electronic equipment, contributing to resource efficiency.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: From 15 August 2018, the preparation for re-use targets for the WEEE falling within the following categories of Annex III shall be: - 80% for Category 1 or Category 4 - 70% for Category 2 - 55% for Category 5 or Category 6
column5: This target sets specific reuse targets for waste electrical and electronic equipment, contributing to a circular economy.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: From 15 August 2018, the recycling targets for the WEEE falling within the following categories of Annex III shall be: - 0% for Category 1 or Category 4 - 70% for Category 2 - 55% for Category 5 or Category 6
column5: This target sets specific recycling targets for waste electrical and electronic equipment, contributing to resource efficiency.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: By 2025, the preparing for re-use and recycling of municipal waste shall be increased to a minimum of 55% by weight (60% by 2030, 65% by 2035)
column5: This target sets specific reuse and recycling targets for municipal waste, contributing to a circular economy.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Member States should aim to achieve an indicative Union-wide food waste reduction target of 30 % by 2025 and 50 % by 2030
column5: This target sets specific goals for reducing food waste, contributing to a circular economy.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Hazardous household waste will have to be collected separately by 2022, bio-waste by 2023 and textiles by 2025
column5: This target sets specific collection targets for various waste types, contributing to a circular economy.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: nan
column5: This target is related to batteries, which are crucial for energy storage and a circular economy.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: By 2030 producers will have responsibility for their products along the value chain, including when they become waste. The circular textiles ecosystem is thriving, driven by sufficient capacities for innovative fibre-to-fibre recycling, while the incineration and landfilling of textiles is reduced to the minimum.
column5: This target focuses on producer responsibility for products, contributing to a circular economy.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: nan
column5: This target is related to batteries, which are crucial for energy storage and a circular economy.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: nan
column5: This target is related to batteries, which are crucial for energy storage and a circular economy.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Union's access to a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials by ensuring that the Union's extraction capacity is able to extract the ores, minerals or concentrates needed to produce at least 10% of the Union's annual consumption of strategic raw materials, to the extent that the Union’s reserves allow for this
column5: This target focuses on securing a sustainable supply of critical raw materials through extraction, contributing to resource efficiency.

column1: TA3_Industrial strategy for a clean and circular economy
column4: Union's access to a secure and sustainable supply of critical raw materials by ensuring that the Union's processing capacity, including for all intermediate processing steps, is able to produce at least 40% of the Union's annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column5: This target focuses on securing a sustainable supply of critical raw materials through processing, contributing to resource efficiency.

column4: *The amendments in Dir. 2023/2413 are also intended to support the achievement of the Union’s target of an annual production of sustainable biomethane of 35 billion cubic meters by 2030, set out in the SWD(2022) 230 of 18 May 2022 accompanying the REPowerEU Plan Taken from Directive (EU) 2023/2413 as regards the promotion of energy from renewable sources
column5: This target focuses on increasing biomethane production, contributing to sustainable energy in the mobility sector.

column4: EU fisheries are encouraged to continue the positive trend, as observed for the period 2009-2019, towards reducing fuel intensity by reducing the fossil-fuel consumption per kg of landed product for at least an additional 15% for the period 2019-2030
column5: This target focuses on reducing fuel intensity in fisheries, contributing to sustainable mobility in the sector.

column4: Reduce the average door-to-door cost of combined transport operations by at least 10% within 7 years
column5: This target focuses on reducing transport costs, contributing to more efficient and sustainable mobility.

column4: GHG intensity reduction target in the maritme sector (link Agreement Council - Parliament on 23.03.2023): -2% from 1 January 2025, -6% from 1 January 2030, -14.5% from 1 January 2035, -31% from 1 January 2040, -62% from 1 January 2045, -80% from 1 January 2050)
column5: This target sets specific GHG intensity reduction goals for the maritime sector, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: For new urban buses the share of zeroemissions vehicles shall be 100% as from the reporting period of the year 2030
column5: This target focuses on transitioning to zero-emission urban buses, contributing to sustainable urban mobility.

column4: Renewable and low-carbon fuels should represent between 6% and 9% of the international maritime transport fuel mix by 2030 and between 86% and 88% by 2050
column5: This target sets specific goals for the fuel mix in maritime transport, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: The average CO2 emissions of the Union fleet of new heavy-duty motor vehicles, other than special purpose, off-road, off-road special purpose, and vocational vehicles shall be reduced by the following percentages compared to the average CO2 emissions of the reporting period of the year 2019: (a) for vehicle sub-groups 4-UD, 4-RD, 4-LH, 5-RD, 5-LH, 9-RD, 9-LH, 10-RD, 10-LH for the reporting periods of the years 2025 to 2029 by 15 %, for all vehicle sub-groups for the reporting periods of the years 2030 to 2034 by 45 %, (c) for all vehicle sub-groups for the reporting periods of the years 2035 to 2039 by 65 %, (d) for all vehicle sub-groups for the reporting periods of the years 2040 onwards by 90%
column5: This target sets specific CO2 emissions reduction goals for heavy-duty vehicles, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: From 1 January 2020, this Regulation sets an EU fleet-wide target of 95 g CO2/km for the average emissions of new passenger cars and an EU fleet-wide target of 147 g CO2/km for the average emissions of new light commercial vehicles registered in the Union, as measured until 31 December 2020 in accordance with Regulation (EC) No 692/2008 together with Implementing Regulations (EU) 2017/1152 and (EU) 2017/1153, and from 1 January 2021 measured in accordance with Regulation (EU) 2017/1151.
column5: This target sets specific CO2 emissions targets for passenger cars and light commercial vehicles, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: This Regulation will, until 31 December 2024, be complemented by additional measures corresponding to a reduction of 10 g CO2/km as part of the Union's integrated approach referred to in the Commission's communication of 7 February 2007 entitled ‘Results of the review of the Community Strategy to reduce CO2 emissions from passenger cars and light-commercial vehicles
column5: This target focuses on additional measures to reduce CO2 emissions from passenger cars, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: nan
column5: This target is related to reducing GHG intensity in the maritime sector, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: nan
column5: This target is related to reducing GHG intensity in the maritime sector, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: nan
column5: This target is related to renewable hydrogen, which is crucial for sustainable mobility.

column4: In the first phase, from 2020 up to 2024, the strategic objective is to install at least 6 GW of renewable hydrogen electrolysers in the EU and the production of up to 1 million tonnes of renewable hydrogen. In the second phase, from 2025 up to 2030, the strategic objective is to install at least 40 GW of renewable hydrogen electrolysers and the production of up to 10 million tonnes of renewable hydrogen in the EU
column5: This target focuses on increasing renewable hydrogen capacity, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: In a third phase, from 2030 onwards and towards 2050, renewable hydrogen technologies should reach maturity and be deployed at large scale to reach all hard-to-decarbonise sectors where other alternatives might not be feasible or have higher costs. In this phase, renewable electricity production needs to massively increase as about a quarter of renewable electricity might be used for renewable hydrogen production by 2050
column5: This target focuses on the large-scale deployment of renewable hydrogen technologies, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Build three million public electric charging points by 2030. Build one million public electric charging points by 2025.
column5: This target focuses on expanding electric charging infrastructure, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Build 1.000 hydrogen stations by 2030. By 2025, build half of the 1.000 hydrogen stations needed for 2030
column5: This target focuses on expanding hydrogen refueling infrastructure, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: nan
column5: This target is related to reducing GHG intensity in the maritime sector, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Member States shall ensure that, at the end of each year, starting from the year referred to in Article 26, the following power output targets are met cumulatively: (a) for each light-duty battery electric vehicle registered in their territory, a total power output of at least 1,3 kW is provided through publicly accessible recharging stations, and (b) for each light-duty plug-in hybrid vehicle registered in their territory, a total power output of at least 0,80 kW is provided through publicly accessible recharging stations
column5: This target sets specific power output targets for electric vehicle charging, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Member States shall ensure that along the TEN-T core and comprehensive networks, publicly accessible recharging pools dedicated to light-duty vehiclesdeployed in each direction of travel with a maximum distance of 60 km in-between them offering a power output of at least 600kW and including at least one recharging point with an individual power output of at least 150 kW
column5: This target focuses on expanding electric charging infrastructure along transport networks, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: By 31 December 2030 (with intermediate 2025 and 2027 targets), along the TEN-T core road network, publicly accessible recharging pools dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles are deployed in each direction of travel with a maximum distance of 60 km between them [...] (with intermediate 2025 and 2027 targets). Along the TEN-T comprehensive road network, recharging pools dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles are deployed in each direction of travel with a maximum distance of 100 km between them and each recharging pool offers a power output of at least 1 500 kW and includes at least one recharging point with an individual power output of at least 350 kW
column5: This target focuses on expanding electric charging infrastructure for heavy-duty vehicles, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: by 31 December 2030, in each safe and secure parking area at least four publicly accessible recharging stations dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles with an individual power output of at least 100 kW are deployed
column5: This target focuses on expanding electric charging infrastructure in parking areas, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: By 31 December 2030, in each urban node publicly accessible recharging points dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles with an aggregated power output of at least 1 800 kW are deployed, provided by recharging stations with an individual power output of at least 150 kW.
column5: This target focuses on expanding electric charging infrastructure in urban areas, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: The yearly average GHG intensity of the energy used on board by a ship during a reporting period shall not exceed these limits: 2 % from 1 January 2025, 6 % from 1 January 2030, 14,5 % from 1 January 2035, 31 % from 1 January 2040, 62 % from 1 January 2045, 80 % from 1 January 2050.
column5: This target sets specific GHG intensity limits for maritime energy use, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Member States shall ensure that, by 31 December 2030, at least one publicly accessible hydrogen refuelling station is deployed in each urban node.
column5: This target focuses on expanding hydrogen refueling infrastructure in urban areas, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Member States shall ensure that by 31 December 2030 publicly accessible hydrogen refuelling stations designed for a minimum cumulative capacity of 1 tonne per day and equipped with at least a 700 bar dispenser are deployed with a maximum distance of 200 km between them along the TEN-T core network
column5: This target focuses on expanding hydrogen refueling infrastructure along transport networks, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Member States shall ensure that, at all airports of the TEN-T core network and TEN-T comprehensive network, the provision of electricity supply to stationary aircraft is ensured by 31 December 2029, at all aircraft remote stands used for commercial air transport operations to embark or disembark passengers or to load or unload goods
column5: This target focuses on providing electricity supply to stationary aircraft, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Member States shall ensure that at least one installation providing shore-side electricity supply to inland waterway vessels is deployed at all TEN-T core inland waterway ports by 1 January 2025, at least one installation providing shore-side electricity supply to inland waterway vessels is deployed at all TEN-T comprehensive inland waterway ports by 1 January 2030.
column5: This target focuses on providing shore-side electricity supply to inland waterway vessels, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Member States shall ensure that a minimum shore-side electricity supply for seagoing container ships and seagoing passenger ships is provided in TEN-T maritime ports. To that end, by 31 December 2029 TEN-T core and comprehensive maritime ports [...] are equipped to provide each year shore-side electricity supply for at least 90 % of the total number of port calls of seagoing container ships above 5.000 gross tonnes that are moored at the quayside at the maritime port concerned and 90% of the total number of port calls of seagoing ro-ro passenger ships above 5 000 gross tonnes and seagoing high-speed passenger craft above 5 000 gross tonnes that are moored at the quayside at the maritime port concerned
column5: This target focuses on providing shore-side electricity supply to seagoing ships, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: nan
column5: This target is related to reducing GHG intensity in the maritime sector, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Transport by inland waterways and short sea shipping will increase by 25% compared to 2015, by 2030. They will increase by 50% by 2050.
column5: This target focuses on increasing transport by inland waterways and short sea shipping, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Rail freight traffic will increase by 50% compared to 2015 by 2030. It will double by 2050.
column5: This target focuses on increasing rail freight traffic, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Freight transport will be paperless
column5: This target focuses on digitizing freight transport, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: High-speed rail traffic will double compared to 2015, by 2030. It will triple by 2050.
column5: This target focuses on increasing high-speed rail traffic, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: The multimodal Trans-European Transport Network (TEN-T) equipped for sustainable and smart transport with high speed connectivity will be operational for the core network, by 2030. It will be operational for the comprehensive network, by 2050.
column5: This target focuses on developing the TEN-T network for sustainable and smart transport, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: A target for the use of RFNBO of 2% of the energy used on board by a ship from 2034
column5: This target sets a specific goal for the use of renewable fuels of non-biological origin in maritime transport, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Rail and waterborne-based intermodal transport will be able to compete on equal footing with road-only transport in the EU
column5: This target focuses on enhancing intermodal transport, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: nan
column5: This target is related to reducing GHG intensity in the maritime sector, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: nan
column5: This target is related to reducing GHG intensity in the maritime sector, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Scheduled collective travel of under 500 km should be carbon neutral within the EU
column5: This target focuses on achieving carbon neutrality for short-distance collective travel, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Nearly all cars, vans, buses as well as new heavy-duty vehicles will be zero-emission
column5: This target focuses on transitioning to zero-emission vehicles, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: There will be at least 30 million zero-emission cars and 80.000 zero-emission lorries in operation
column5: This target sets specific goals for the number of zero-emission vehicles, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Zero-emission ocean-going vessels will become market ready
column5: This target focuses on developing zero-emission ocean-going vessels, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Zero-emission large zero-emission aircraft will become market ready
column5: This target focuses on developing zero-emission aircraft, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Euro 7 pollutant limits
column5: This target sets specific pollutant limits for vehicles, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: nan
column5: This target is related to reducing GHG intensity in the maritime sector, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: nan
column5: This target is related to reducing GHG intensity in the maritime sector, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Starting from 2025, at least 2% of aviation fuels will be green, with this share increasing every five years: 6% in 2030, 20% in 2035, 34% in 2040, 42% in 2045 and 70% in 2050. Hydrogen and fuel produced from cooking oil or waste gases considered green (link agreement Council - Parliament on 25.04.2023)
column5: This target sets specific goals for the share of green aviation fuels, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: All external costs of transport within the EU will be covered by the transport users
column5: This target focuses on internalizing external transport costs, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Seamless multimodal passenger transport will be facilitated by integrated electronic ticketing
column5: This target focuses on enhancing multimodal transport through electronic ticketing, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: The death toll for all modes of transport in the EU will be close to zero
column5: This target focuses on improving transport safety, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Active transport modes, such as cycling, have seen growth with cities announcing over 2300 km of extra cycling infrastructure. This should be doubled in the next decade towards 5000 km in safe bike lanes
column5: This target focuses on promoting active transport modes, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Zero-emission in urban logistics
column5: This target focuses on achieving zero-emission urban logistics, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Increase the uptake of short-sea shipping instead of using more polluting modes
column5: This target focuses on promoting short-sea shipping, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Renovate the EU’s maritime fleet (e.g. passenger ships and supply vessels for offshore installations) to improve their energy efficiency
column5: This target focuses on renovating the maritime fleet for energy efficiency, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Pursue the objective of zero-emission ports
column5: This target focuses on achieving zero-emission ports, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Synthetic aviation fuels are expected to play a role in the decarbonisation of the sector already by 2030 and should contribute to at least 35% of the aviation fuel mix by 2050, according to the EC proposal for ReFuelEU Aviation
column5: This target sets specific goals for the share of synthetic aviation fuels, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Each Member State shall set an obligation on fuel suppliers to ensure that: (B) the combined share of advanced biofuels and biogas produced from the feedstock listed in Part A of Annex IX and of renewable fuels of nonbiological origin in the energy supplied to the transport sector is at least 1 % in 2025 and 3,5 % in 2030, of which a share of at least 1 percentage point is from renewable fuels of non-biological origin in 2030
column5: This target sets specific goals for the share of advanced biofuels and renewable fuels in transport, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Member States with maritime ports should endeavour to ensure that from 2030 the share of renewable fuels of non-biological origin in the total amount of energy supplied to the maritime transport sector is at least 1,2 %.
column5: This target sets specific goals for the share of renewable fuels in maritime transport, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column4: Cut the emissions of transport sector by 90%
column5: This target sets a specific goal for reducing transport emissions, contributing to sustainable mobility.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: nan
column5: This target is related to reducing antimicrobial use, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Increase renewable energy in agriculture and food sector. Adopt energy efficiency solutions in the agriculture and food sector, by reducing energy consumption in the sector
column5: This target focuses on increasing renewable energy use and energy efficiency in agriculture, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Protect the environment and restore natural resources. Preserve biodiversity and reduce biodiversity loss.
column5: This target focuses on protecting biodiversity and natural resources, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Secure and ensure access to a range of quality seeds for plant varieties in order to adapt to the pressures of climate change
column5: This target focuses on ensuring access to quality seeds, contributing to agricultural resilience.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Reduce food waste. Prevent food loss and waste. Halve per capita food waste at retail and consumer levels
column5: This target focuses on reducing food waste, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Scale-up and promote sustainable and socially responsible production methods and circular business models in food processing and retail.
column5: This target focuses on promoting sustainable production methods, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Reduce the environmental and climate footprint of the EU food system, operating within planetary boundaries
column5: This target focuses on reducing the environmental footprint of the food system, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Ensure fair income and salaries. Improve income of primary producers to ensure their sustainable livelihood.
column5: This target focuses on ensuring fair income for primary producers, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Help farmers and fishers to strengthen their position in the supply chain and to capture a fair share of the added value of sustainable production
column5: This target focuses on strengthening the position of farmers and fishers in the supply chain, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Improve agricultural rules that strengthen the position of farmers (e.g. producers of products with geographical indications), their cooperatives and producer organisations in the food supply chain._
column5: This target focuses on improving agricultural rules to support farmers, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Preserve the affordability of food.
column5: This target focuses on ensuring food affordability, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Reduce overall EU sales of antimicrobials for farmed animals and in aquaculture by 50% by 2030.
column5: This target focuses on reducing antimicrobial use in agriculture, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Foster the competitiveness of the EU supply sector
column5: This target focuses on enhancing the competitiveness of the EU supply sector, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Ensure access to fast broadband to all farmers and all rural areas (enabler for jobs, businesses, investments, improvement in quality of life in rural areas and enabler to mainstream precision farming and use of artificial intelligence)
column5: This target focuses on ensuring broadband access in rural areas, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Create shorter supply chains will support reducing dependence on long-haul transportation.
column5: This target focuses on creating shorter supply chains, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Create new job opportunities.
column5: This target focuses on creating job opportunities, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Ensure Fair, inclusive and ethical value chains. Improve working conditions, ensure occupation health and safety. Ensure workers’ social protection and housing conditions, promote socially responsible production methods, Mitigate the socio-economic consequences impacting the food chain and ensure that the key principles enshrined in the European Pillar of Social Rights are respected, especially when it comes to precarious, seasonal and undeclared workers.
column5: This target focuses on ensuring fair and ethical value chains, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Promote better animal welfare to improve animal health and food quality
column5: This target focuses on promoting animal welfare, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Strengthen educational messages on the importance of healthy nutrition, sustainable food production and consumption, and reducing food waste.
column5: This target focuses on promoting nutrition education, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Provide food information and labelling to empower consumers to make informed, healthy and sustainable food choices
column5: This target focuses on providing food information and labelling, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Extend the mandatory origin or provenance indications to certain products.
column5: This target focuses on extending origin indications, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Improve availability of sustainable food. Ensure that the healthy option is always the easiest one. Ensure food supply.
column5: This target focuses on improving the availability of sustainable food, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Reduce nutrient losses by at least 50%, while ensuring no deterioration on soil fertility
column5: This target focuses on reducing nutrient losses, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Ensure affordability and access to sufficient, nutritious and sustainable food.
column5: This target focuses on ensuring food affordability and access, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Increase reformulation of food products in line with guidelines for healthy and sustainable diets
column5: This target focuses on reformulating food products, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Ensuring all access to quality, safe, sustainable, nutritious food.
column5: This target focuses on ensuring access to quality food, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Move to healthier and more sustainable diets
column5: This target focuses on promoting sustainable diets, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Reverse prevalence of overweight and diet-related diseases
column5: This target focuses on reducing overweight and diet-related diseases, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Strengthen the resilience of the EU food system. Build up resilience to possible future diseases and pandemics. Increasing the sustainability of food producers will ultimately increase their resilience.
column5: This target focuses on strengthening food system resilience, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: nan
column5: This target is related to reducing antimicrobial use, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: nan
column5: This target is related to reducing antimicrobial use, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Reduce by 50% the use of more hazardous pesticides (target in common with the Biodiversity Strategy and Zero Pollution Action Plan)
column5: This target focuses on reducing hazardous pesticide use, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Reduce by 50% the use and risk of chemical pesticides (target in common with the Biodiversity Strategy and Zero Pollution Action Plan)
column5: This target focuses on reducing chemical pesticide use, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Increase sustainable fishing and aquaculture. Bring fish stocks to sustainable levels. Significant increase in organic aquaculture (target in common with CFP)
column5: This target focuses on promoting sustainable fishing and aquaculture, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Tackle climate change: climate change adaptation and mitigation. Ensure that agriculture, fisheries and aquaculture, and the food value chain contribute to the target of reducing greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030 and to the achievement of the objective for a climate neutral Union in 2050.
column5: This target focuses on climate change mitigation in agriculture, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Sustainable use of water. Preserving freshwater, boosting water reuse in agriculture.
column5: This target focuses on sustainable water use in agriculture, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column1: TA5_Greening the Common Agricultural Policy - Farm to Fork Strategy
column4: Increase organic farming with the aim to achieve at least 25% of total farmland under organic farming by 2030 (target in common with the Biodiversity Strategy 2030)
column5: This target focuses on increasing organic farming, contributing to sustainable agriculture.

column4: 1.a Legally protect a minimum of 30% of the EU's land area
column5: This target focuses on legally protecting land, contributing to biodiversity preservation.

column4: 7. At least 10% of agricultural area is under high-diversity landscape features
column5: This target focuses on increasing biodiversity in agricultural areas, contributing to biodiversity preservation.

column4: 9. Three billion trees are planted in the EU, in full respect of ecological principles
column5: This target focuses on tree planting, contributing to biodiversity preservation.

column4: 10. Significant progress in the remediation of contaminated soil sites
column5: This target focuses on soil remediation, contributing to biodiversity preservation.

column4: 11. At least 25.000 km of free-flowing rivers are restored
column5: This target focuses on river restoration, contributing to biodiversity preservation.

column4: 12. There is a 50% reduction in the number of Red List species threatened by invasive alien species
column5: This target focuses on reducing invasive species threats, contributing to biodiversity preservation.

column4: 13. The losses of nutrients from fertilisers are reduced by 50%, resulting in the reduction of the use of fertilisers by at least 20%
column5: This target focuses on reducing nutrient losses, contributing to biodiversity preservation.

column4: 14. Cities with at least 20.000 inhabitants have an ambitious Urban Greening Plan
column5: This target focuses on urban greening, contributing to biodiversity preservation.

column4: 15. The negative impacts on sensitive species and habitats, including on the seabed through fishing and extraction activities, are substantially reduced to achieve good environmental status
column5: This target focuses on reducing negative impacts on habitats, contributing to biodiversity preservation.

column4: 16. The by-catch of species is eliminated or reduced to a level that allows species recovery and conservation
column5: This target focuses on reducing by-catch, contributing to biodiversity preservation.

column5: This target is related to biodiversity protection, contributing to biodiversity preservation.

column5: This target focuses on legally protecting sea areas, contributing to biodiversity preservation.

column5: This target is related to biodiversity protection, contributing to biodiversity preservation.

column4: Combat desertification, restore degraded land and soil, including land affected by desertification, drought and floods, and strive to achieve a land degradation-neutral world (SDG 15.3)
column5: This target focuses on land restoration, contributing to biodiversity preservation.

column4: nan
column5: This target is related to biodiversity protection, contributing to biodiversity preservation.

column4: nan
column5: This target is related to biodiversity protection, contributing to biodiversity preservation.

column4: nan
column5: This target is related to biodiversity protection, contributing to biodiversity preservation.

column4: nan
column5: This target is related to biodiversity protection, contributing to biodiversity preservation.

column4: Ensure that incidental catches of sensitive marine species, including those listed under Directives 92/43/EEC and 2009/147/EC, that are a result of fishing, are minimised and where possible eliminated so that they do not represent a threat to the conservation status of these species
column5: This target focuses on reducing marine by-catch, contributing to biodiversity preservation.

column4: Optimise exploitation patterns to provide protection for juveniles and spawning aggregations of marine biological resources
column5: This target focuses on protecting marine resources, contributing to biodiversity preservation.
